(1)
408-420 Cherry Street, north side, between Jackaon and Scammel
Streets. The 3-story garage is No. 420.
March 23, 1937.

(2)

719219f-a.text:
Corlears Hook Park: A panoramic set of 2 views, westward from the East River, showing this play area that is bounded by Jackson (left), Cherry (background) and Corlears (right) Streets. Upon the latter are two factory structures, one occupied by Hecker Jones, Jewell Milling Co., and the other by the Standard Milling Co. These buildings obscure a view of the Williamsburg Bridge, which is slightly northward.
July 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
719219f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

720660f-a.text:
(1) Jackson Street, north from and including Cherry, to and including Grand Streets.  Also shown, in the foreground, is the North Western corner of Corlears Hook Park, West side of Street. On the right are shown #444-445 Cherry Street, adjoining and East of the North East corner of Jackson Street.  The five story corner house bears the number #44, on the latter Street.
March 23, 1937

(2) Jackson Street, East side and North East corner at Cherry Street and looking northwards.
April 25, 1939

Photographs by,
P. L. Sperr
720660f-a.folder: Jackson Street & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY

720660f-b.text:
(1) Jackson Street, north from and including Cherry, to and including Grand Streets.  Also shown, in the foreground, is the North Western corner of Corlears Hook Park, West side of Street. On the right are shown #444-445 Cherry Street, adjoining and East of the North East corner of Jackson Street.  The five story corner house bears the number #44, on the latter Street.
March 23, 1937

(2) Jackson Street, East side and North East corner at Cherry Street and looking northwards.
April 25, 1939

Photographs by,
P. L. Sperr
720660f-b.folder: Jackson Street & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY

reconstruction work.
P.L.Speer.

718758f-a.text:
Cherry Street, north side, east of Jackson Street, showing tenements prior to demolition. This slum clearance project will
provide a site for the "Vladeck Houses."
April 25, 1939
P. L. Sperr

719216f-a.text:
Corlears Hook Park: A northward view towards Cherry Street from the East River. At the left and right, respectively are Jackson and Corlears Street. On the formar, at Madison Street, is the instutional P. S. 12. This appears because of the demolition of several blocks of tenements that formerly would obscure the view. Upon this prepared site will rise the N. Y. City and the U. S. H. A. Houses, the Vladeck City Houses and tho Vladeck Houses. Skirting the waters edge will be the East River
Drive.
July 28, 1939
Sept 18, 1939
P. L. Sperr
719216f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

719216f-b.text:
Corlears Hook Park: A northward view towards Cherry Street from the East River. At the left and right, respectively are Jackson and Corlears Street. On the formar, at Madison Street, is the instutional P. S. 12. This appears because of the demolition of several blocks of tenements that formerly would obscure the view. Upon this prepared site will rise the N. Y. City and the U. S. H. A. Houses, the Vladeck City Houses and tho Vladeck Houses. Skirting the waters edge will be the East River
Drive.
July 28, 1939
Sept 18, 1939
P. L. Sperr
719216f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

719217f-b.text:
Corloars Hook Park: A northward view from the East River shore. In the background are buildings on the marginal Cherry Street, axtending from Jackson Street on the laft to Corlears Street on the right. The bandw stand is in a line with these. Those to the left are to be removed for the N. Y. City built, Vladeck Houses. The new East River Lrive will skirt the waters edge.
April 25, 1939
May 7, 1939
P. L. Sperr
719217f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

718755f-a.text:
Cherry 8treet, east from, No. 424, a garage, west of the N.W. corMner of Jackson Street. Note the Williamsburg Bridge in the backgronnd.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
A similar view, showing mainly the south side. The building whose
side wall is vividly apparent, is No. 423.
March 23, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Aview of the same area shown in No. 1 from a point
slightly receded and as in that instance, across Jackson Street. These buildings are being demolished for the Vladeck City Houses, a project finaced by the City and its adjoining Vladeck Houses, n USFA sponsered feature. The shells of tenements appearing at the left are at the S.W. corner of Monroe and Jackson Streets.
718755f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

720659f-b.text:
(1)
47-49 Jackson Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Cherry Street. Buildings shown are of frame, with brick fronts. Note the Cherry Street
side of same.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of Now York.
Hegative No. 4.
(2)
The same, including the lower stories of Nos. 43 and 41 Jaokson Street,
at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Cherry Street.
May 1929.
Eugene 1  Armbruster Collection.
